wikipedia_page.main:
Martin O'Neill (born 17 June 1975) is a Scottish former professional footballer, who played for Clyde, Kilmarnock, Stranraer, Clydebank, Stirling Albion, East Fife and Dumbarton  in the Scottish Football League.
He played for the Scotland U21 team at the Toulon Tournament in 1997. The team were beaten by Brazil in the semi-finals.O'Neill later returned to Clyde in a non-playing capacity, working in a marketing role in May 2007.

response: Martin O'Neill (born 1952) is a retired footballer and current football manager.
Martin O'Neill may also refer to:
*Martin O'Neill, Baron O'Neill of Clackmannan (1945–2020), Scottish politician
*Martin O'Neill (footballer, born 1975), a former Scottish footballer
*Martin O'Neill (hurler) in 2012 All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship
